initial_story: in recent years, classical convolutional neural networks (cnns) have beenapplied for image recognition successfully. quantum convolutional neuralnetworks (qcnns) are proposed as a novel generalization to cnns by usingquantum mechanisms. the quantum mechanisms lead to an efficient trainingprocess in qcnns by reducing the size of input from $n$ to $log_2n$. this paperimplements and compares both cnns and qcnns by testing losses and predictionaccuracy on three commonly used datasets. the datasets include the mnisthand-written digits, fashion mnist and cat/dog face images. additionally, dataaugmentation (da), a technique commonly used in cnns to improve the performanceof classification by generating similar images based on original inputs, isalso implemented in qcnns. surprisingly, the results showed that dataaugmentation didn't improve qcnns performance. the reasons and logic behindthis result are discussed, hoping to expand our understanding of quantummachine learning theory.

In recent years, classical convolutional neural networks (CNNs) have been applied for image recognition successfully. Quantum convolutional neural networks (QCNNs) are proposed as a novel generalization to CNNs by using quantum mechanisms. The quantum mechanisms lead to an efficient training process in QCNNs by reducing the size of input from $n$ to $log_2n$. This paper implements and compares both CNNs and QCNNs by testing losses and prediction accuracy on three commonly used datasets. The datasets include the MNIST hand-written digits, Fashion MNIST, and Cat/Dog face images. Additionally, data augmentation (DA), a technique commonly used in CNNs to improve the performance of classification by generating similar images based on original inputs, is also implemented in QCNNs.

It is surprising that data augmentation didn't improve the performance of QCNNs. In classical CNNs, data augmentation has been proven to be an effective technique to improve the classification accuracy by generating similar images based on original inputs. However, in QCNNs, data augmentation didn't lead to any improvement in the loss or prediction accuracy. This could be due to the following reasons:

Quantum convolutional neural networks (QCNNs) are based on quantum mechanics, which is fundamentally different from classical mechanics. QCNNs use quantum algorithms to train the model, and the quantum algorithms may not be compatible with data augmentation techniques that are commonly used in classical CNNs.

Data augmentation in classical CNNs works by generating similar images based on original inputs, which increases the size of the training dataset. However, in QCNNs, the input size is already reduced to $log_2n$ due to quantum mechanisms. Adding more similar images may not necessarily improve the performance of QCNNs.

Data augmentation in classical CNNs is based on transformations such as flipping, cropping, and rotation. However, in QCNNs, the input is in the form of a quantum state, which may not be compatible with these transformations.

Data augmentation in classical CNNs is based on the assumption that the input images are correlated, and generating similar images can capture these correlations. However, in QCNNs, the input is in the form of a quantum state, which may not have any correlations with the original input.

Data augmentation in classical CNNs is based on the assumption that the input images have a certain distribution, and generating similar images can capture this distribution. However, in QCNNs, the input is in the form of a quantum state, which may not have any distribution.

Data augmentation in classical CNNs is based on the assumption that the input images have a certain structure, and generating similar images can capture this structure. However, in QCNNs, the input is in the form of a quantum state, which may not have any structure.

In conclusion, data augmentation didn't improve the performance of QCNNs due to the fundamental differences between classical CNNs and QCNNs. Quantum mechanisms used in QCNNs may not be compatible with data augmentation techniques that are commonly used in classical CNNs.

Curious, I waded out to retrieve it. When I opened the bottle, I was surprised to find a message inside. It was a plea for help, from a person stranded on a deserted island. I couldn't believe it. Someone was stranded out there, all alone, and I was the only one who could help.

Without hesitation, I jumped into action. I gathered my things and headed back to my car, determined to reach the person before it was too late.

As I drove, I thought about the person on the island, and how scared and alone they must be feeling. I was determined to get to them as soon as possible.

Finally, after hours of driving, I reached the beach where the bottle had washed up. I scanned the horizon, looking for any signs of life. And then, I saw it. A small boat, just off the shore.

I rushed down to the water, waving my arms, trying to get the person's attention. And then, suddenly, they saw me.

I helped them onto the shore, and they were so grateful to be safe and sound. We talked for hours, sharing stories and laughing together. It was one of the most incredible experiences of my life.

And as we parted ways, I knew that this day would be one that I would never forget.

But as I turned to leave, I realized that I had left my phone on the beach. I hurried back to retrieve it, but as I approached the spot where I had left it, I saw that it was gone.

I searched the sand, but it was nowhere to be found. I knew that I needed to get in touch with the person I had rescued, but without my phone, I had no way to do so.

I felt a sense of desperation as I realized that I had lost my only chance to help the person I had saved. I knew that I had to do something, but I had no idea what.

Just then, I heard a faint sound coming from the direction of the beach. I turned to look, and to my surprise, I saw a small plane flying overhead.

I ran down to the beach, waving my arms and shouting as loud as I could. And then, suddenly, the plane began to descend.

The pilot landed the plane on the beach, and I rushed over to greet him. He told me that he had seen my distress signal, and had come to help.

Together, we searched the surrounding area, looking for any signs of the person I had rescued. And then, finally, we found them.

They were safe and sound, and they were so grateful to have been rescued. We talked for hours, sharing stories and laughing together. It was one of the most incredible experiences of my life.

And as we parted ways, I knew that this day would be one that I would never forget.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Alice who loved to play with her doll, Anna. Every day, Alice would dress Anna up in different outfits and pretend that she was going on grand adventures.

One day, Alice was playing with Anna in the backyard when she heard a loud crash. Curious, she went to investigate and found a broken window in the house.

Alice knew that she had to fix the window before her parents found out, so she went to find the tools she would need. Unfortunately, the tools were scattered all over the house and Alice didn't know where to start.

Just then, Anna spoke up. "Alice, why don't you ask your brother for help?" Alice was surprised that her doll could talk, but she decided to take her advice.

Alice found her brother, Tom, and asked him for help fixing the window. Tom was happy to help and they quickly got to work.

While they were working, Alice and Tom started talking about their favorite things. Tom told Alice that he loved to play video games and Alice told Tom that she loved to read books.

As they worked, Alice realized that she had more in common with her brother than she thought. They laughed and joked together and before they knew it, the window was fixed.

Alice and Tom celebrated their victory with a game of tag in the backyard. They had so much fun that they didn't even realize that their parents had come home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Alice who loved to play with her doll, Anna. Every day, Alice would dress Anna up in different outfits and pretend that she was going on grand adventures.

One day, Alice was playing with Anna in the backyard when she heard a loud crash. Curious, she went to investigate and found a broken window in the house.

Alice knew that she had to fix the window before her parents found out, so she went to find the tools she would need. Unfortunately, the tools were scattered all over the house and Alice didn't know where to start.

Just then, Anna spoke up. "Alice, why don't you ask your brother for help?" Alice was surprised that her doll could talk, but she decided to take her advice.

Alice found her brother, Tom, and asked him for help fixing the window. Tom was happy to help and they quickly got to work.

As they worked, Alice and Tom started talking about their favorite things. Tom told Alice that he loved to play video games and Alice told Tom that she loved to read books.

While they were working, Alice realized that she had more in common with her brother than she thought. They laughed and joked together and before they knew it, the window was fixed.

Alice and Tom celebrated their victory with a game of tag in the backyard. They had so much fun that they didn't even realize that their parents had come home.

When their parents saw them playing together, they were overjoyed. They had always hoped that Alice and Tom would be friends, and now they were.

From that day on, Alice and Tom were the best of friends. They played together every day and never let anything come between them.

And every time they played together, Alice would dress Anna up in a new outfit and they would go on new adventures together.

But there was one adventure that Alice and Tom had not yet gone on, and it was one that they would never forget. It all started when Anna spoke up again.

"Alice, I have a secret to tell you," Anna said. "I can talk to animals."

Alice was surprised, but she decided to believe Anna. After all, Anna had helped her fix the window.
